p: The compounds of O. campechianum essential oil are reported in Table 1; distillation yields were of 0.68%. As previously published by us [ 34], the yields for O. quixos essential oil were 0.13%, for P. aduncum 0.12%. The essential oil of O. campechianum was found to be rich in eugenol (18.6%), β-caryophyllene (17.0%), 1,8-cineole (11.4%), bicyclogermacrene (9%), cis-ocimene (8%) and α-caryophyllene (4.5%), that of O. quixos was characterised by 1,8-cineole (39.2%), sabinene (6.5%), α-pinene (6.3%), β-caryophyllene (4.7%) and terpinen-4-ol (4.2%), and P. aduncum essential oil showed a high percentage of dillapiole (48.2%) followed by trans-ocimene (7.5%) and β-caryophyllene (4.8%) [ 34].
